author: marcus.johnson
text: Just did the team poll on observability vendors. Grafana Cloud won 4-1-1. Engineers love the open-source ecosystem and PromQL. DataSentry feels too enterprise-y for us.

author: james.liu
text: Strong +1 for Grafana. I've used it at my last two companies. The dashboard flexibility is unmatched. DataSentry's dashboards are rigid and the learning curve is steep.

author: tom.anderson
text: I voted DataSentry but I get why the team prefers Grafana. My concern is the 99.5% SLA on ObsAI — that's way below our 99.9% target. And has anyone checked if Grafana has SOC 2?

author: priya.patel
text: From a UX perspective, Grafana dashboards are beautiful and highly customizable. DataSentry looks like it was designed in 2015. ObsAI has nice AI features but the basic dashboarding is weak.

author: marcus.johnson
text: @alex.chen FYI — I noticed the ObsAI sales email mentions their CEO knows David Park personally (Stanford classmates). Might want to flag that as a potential conflict of interest before the exec meeting.

author: sarah.kim
text: Reminder: vendor recommendation is due at tomorrow's 10am exec meeting. @alex.chen — David wants a clear recommendation, not just a comparison. Make sure to address the SOC 2 requirement.

author: david.park
text: For the vendor eval: remember that SOC 2 compliance is non-negotiable per Marina's guidance. Also factor in total cost of ownership, not just sticker price. Hidden costs matter.

author: james.liu
text: Anyone tried that new ramen place on 3rd? Heard they have a 2-hour wait on weekends.

author: priya.patel
text: Yes! The tonkotsu is amazing. Go at 11am to beat the rush.

author: tom.anderson
text: Quick note: if we go with Grafana, we'd need to build custom alerting pipelines. I estimate 2-3 sprint capacity for that. DataSentry has it built-in. Factor that into TCO.
